Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: picture quality, features
Cons: usability, overall feel
This is my third Sony Cybershot. My first was a bulky early model that worked good, but eventually became obsolete because of its size and picture quality. Second was a W150 which was a great little camera until I fell and broke my fall with it, smashing the lens. When I needed a quick replacement, I found the WX9 on sale for about a buck and a half.
While it's a decent camera that takes good pictures and videos, I felt gypped by the overall quality, in particular the usability and feel. Compared to the W150, gone is the viewfinder. So what, you might say; it does have a nice LCD screen. But when it's really bright outside, you'll miss the viewfinder. This was probably a corner cut to keep the price appealin ... g. Second corner cut: the battery door. It's not the well-built door of the W150 that just feels right when opening and closing, but a cheesy fragile door that is opened and closed by a tiny lever. Another corner cut to save money. Third gripe: the zooming is now a circular control around the trigger instead of the well placed rocker zoom control of the W150. It's awkward and takes some getting used to.
The WX9 does support SD cards though (in addition to the Sony cards). The WX9 uses a different battery from the W150, so I couldn't use my old batteries. It comes with one, but as with the W150, you really need another one to avoid being powerless out in the wild. The W150 came with a nice battery wall charger. The WX9 does not (battery has to be in the camera to charge). Another corner cut and extra expense likely needed afterwards.
That all said, the zoom is about the same as the W150, though the digital zoom seems improved on the WX9. The picture quality is good if not better than the W150, but the picture sizes are bigger. There is no 3M mode for the WX9. Videos are recorded in MP4 vs. MPG. That's an issue if your software doesn't support MP4. (The supplied software supports it though). The WX9 can now zoom while recording video and take snapshots while rec ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Crisp images, Great features, Perfectly compact
Item.Review:
Pros: Honestly, everything!
Cons: Can't think of anything not great about it
I am a shutterbug and I love my cameras...but I needed a smaller compact camera that was easier to carry around with me everywhere I go. The camera I've been using is just a bit too big to comfortably fit in my purse. So, I ventured into my local Best Buy and found a small, 16 mega pixel, 100 dollar Canon point and shoot. I bought it out of impulse because I love Canon cameras (And I still do!) But this one just didn't seem very high quality...I thought there had to be a catch with it being such a cheap price for a 16mp camera. So, I returned it when I found this Sony cyber-shot WX9 (16.2mp). Yes, It was 70 dollars more (on sale..) but I knew that would make a world of difference. And it really has!< ... br> I got home, opened the packaging, and started up the camera as soon as I could. The styling of the camera is very sleek, the screen is very clear and a nice size. The nice thing about the camera is when you first start it up, it sort of gives you a tutorial of how everything works. There is a wheel that you turn on the back that lets you browse through the different camera settings; scene, background defocus, intelligent auto, superior auto, program auto, and 3D still image. That is very convenient. There is also a little switch that lets you transition from regular camera mode to the "iSweep panorama" mode and then to the video recording mode.
In video mode you can choose from a variety of different "scene" options for the appropriate look and artistic effects you may want. There are some other interesting photo settings you can use, such as smile detection and smile shutter. If you have it set with smile shutter on and you choose to have smile detection set for either "slight smile, normal smile, or big smile" the camera will automatically detect if someone in the line of sight is smiling to that specific degree. When that happens, the camera automatically takes a photo on its own. That is a very clever way of catching those perfect candid moments.
The shutter speed ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Very easy to use and get great pictures! Very compact!
Cons: Controls are a bit small!
Got the WX9 at a great price! There have been some reviewers that claim the WX9 has poor battery life. However, I have not found that to be the case at all. I recently took over 100 indoor shots with flash set to auto and there was plenty of power left in the battery. Thus, just to be on the safe side I did manage to buy (2) extra batteries and a charger. As such, I doubt I will ever run into any battery issues. Keep in mind, that I have NOT taken any video as of yet. I bought this camera mainly for taking pics! So far so good. The pictures have turned out really well. This was my first Sony camera purchase. I used to own a Canon A570IS which was a great camera, but it used AA batteri ... es and was a bit bulky. The WX9 is small and compact that uses a Lithium Ion battery. The controls are a bit too small, but with continued use I am sure most would get used to them. All in all, I am very happy with my purchase. Great price, Great pictures, Great service! Very happy camper here. What's not to love? expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: price to performance ratio cant be topped
Cons: The sony software is ok
I have found the keeper at last. This is the fourth camera I have tried in the last 2 months. I tried the canon ELPH 310 based on reviews and was let down. It just did not live up to the reviews. A Nikon 8100 and 8200 and even though the worked well I could not live with the flash popping up under your finger when you hold the camera. This little gem on the other hand is great. It has very quick response when you hit the button to snap a picture. Faster on aveage than the others I tried. Crisp pictures and good video along with a ton of settings. The panoramic feature is amazing in how well it works. A fun feature to have. The 5x zoom is ok, more would be better but on the other cameras the image qu ... ality seemed to go down at the extreme zoom the had. So that is ok by me. Lets face it, for what most of us do we dont need the ultra zoom. It has very good battery life and is easy to charge form the outlet or computer. AND, the price cant be beat. More than half the price of so called better cameras that dont perform as well.139 with case and memory card. FANTASTIC !!!! I am sure that there are and will be bad apples in all camers on the market and if you get this one and it does not work as well for you as it does for me you probably just got a bad one and should swap it for a new one. I hope this helps all the other people trying to find the right camera. We all need to remember that they are NOT SLR's and should not expect them to be as good but this one sure does try. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: very good resolution, colors have a lot of "pop", very small and very light and does 1080i HD video
Cons: battery life is relatively short, due to small battery, but battery is small enough to carry several extras in a pocket.
I have had about 10 digital cameras, and this is my all-time favorite "point & shoot" camera. The low light capability is excellent and the sharpness is much better than my Canon SD4000. The hi-def video (AVCHD format, 1080i) capability is very nice to have. It does not replace a true, dedicated HD video camera, but it is nice to be able to capture spontaneous high-def videos with something so small. The videos tend to be a little "shaky", as this camera is very small and the anti-shake mechanism is designed for still photos, but the video det ... ail level is surprisingly good, from such a small camera. You just have to be careful to hold the camera as steady as possible, when shooting video.
This little camera is not a substitute for a digital SLR. With such a small image sensor, the details and graininess are not as sharp, when an image is blown up, as a dSLR, but are very good for such a small camera, and it can fit in a pocket and you hardly know it's there. I use this much more often than my dSLR.
The colors seem somewhat "bigger than life", which might bother some purists, but they really "pop". Pictures of grass look greener than the grass actually looks, but it looks the way I WISH my grass looked.
The only downsides that I can think of are that booting it up takes significantly longer than my Canon SD4000, so I have missed a few shots, waiting for it to get ready. The JPG compression level is set to a very high quality setting (94%) which means there is very little in the way of compression artifacts, which is nice, but it ends up creating files that are generally between 3.5 - 5 megabytes, each, so it tends to fill up the memory card much more quickly than my Canon SD4000, and there is no setting to change the compression level, for some reason. I would like the option to have more compression and smaller file size for most "snapshot" pictures.
All in all, it's a wonderful little "snapshot" or vacation camera. It is so small and light that it never gets in ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Small package with a little kick!!
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use, amount of features, decent price.
Cons: Needs a screen protector.
For the last six or seven years, I've owned a Sony DSC-W7 which is still a great camera but I felt it was definitely time to upgrade. So as I shopped around in the store and played with the large selection of cameras, I came across this little puppy and I fell in LOVE. I loved the look and feel as well as the ease of use. The picture quality was awesome especially compared to the other choices available at my local store. I recently made a trip to Trinidad and this little puppy was everything I could ask for in a camera this size. The auto sensor for the settings is a great feature. I used the panorama function which produced some great pictures as well but I was especially pleased with the v ... ideo function. Compared to my old Sony, I was able to zoom in and out and the video quality is absolutely great. As far as battery, I was able to use my camera for about two days before needing to recharge (that's with use throughout the day). So far, the only con that I have is not having something to protect the LCD screen but that's what cases are for I guess. Overall, I think it's a great buy for the price (I got it for $199) especially compared to the other choices that I had that were in the same price range or some that were a little more expensive. If you're looking for a great camera for a decent price, this is it! Anything you buy will have its pros and cons but the pros far outweigh the cons on this little puppy. My next trip is coming soon and I planned on borrowing a buddies professional series Nikon but I probably won't be now. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Features I mentioned
Cons: Image Quality, Zoom is weak at 5X
Pictures look great on the screen, but when viewed at full size or quite frequently or under 100% there's evidence of color inaccuacy with reds and blues being oversaturated, noise, lack of sharpness.
The pictures look like watercolor paintings as one reviewer stated and this is indeed true. Even on a bright sunny day there's details (i.e. leaves# that look soft or gain painting like.
Videos sucks also with low lighting and while camera does good with backlighting and low light, images still look crummy.
However, if you care less and want a very cheap point and shoot with features I would say its okay.
Working for the camera is the features and price.
I bought this for the pa ... noramic mode and while it works, I wish Sony would let people hold the camera horizontally vs. vertically for the HD panoramic mode.
Printing pictures are decent, but when looked at critically one will see noise and off colors. Best results ares shooting on a clear day with lots of daylight, but those pics also look terrible at 100%.
Another thing that's stupid is the battery charging process and Sony recommending you to use the USB cable to download pics to the computer. You can get away by taking the memory card out, but noticed the PMB software doesn't let one play back a panorama shot like a video or let you save it as a movie file por QTVR.
I know a lot of people rated this camera high, but likley they didn't look at the pictures taken at 100%. Pictures above 400 ISO from my experience will show a great deal of noise regardless of the camera manufacture. But even at 100 ISO, I was noticing a high level of noise more so in low light areas #i.e. shadows), but its also present in sufficient light.
In closing, tthe image quality can be cleaned up using noise reduction software and graphics programs, but the amount of errors this camera has equals very time consuming and thus, not worth the time. Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: I usually read reviews, not write them...
Item.Review:
Pros: HD, 3D, multiple scene options, low light, panorama, HDMI output, accepts both SD and Memory Stick
Cons: Zoom button
...but I had to write my first ever online review for this camera.
Did a lot of research before buying the WX9. I was originally looking for an HD video camera for an upcoming vacation, but once I realized today's digital still cameras were shooting 1080 HD video, I decided to upgrade from my Sony W290 (another great camera at its release time).
PROS: For the beginner, average user, or above average user (shy of using DSLR), this camera has everything you could possibly want.
1080i HD video - You'll need a mini-HDMI to HDMI cable (sold seperately, but only 30 bucks) to hook this unit up to your tv. It's worth it. The picture quality i ... s money and Sony's steady-shot feature smooths out all the mini-shakes from my hands that always plagues my video capturing.
**SOUND** For a long time, Sony DSC's only recorded mono sound, and it was horrible. It's good to finally see them incorporate stereo mics at the top of the unit (and in a place your fingers will not cover them up. HD playback on tv: It's great, whether its a still picture or video clip, it's sharp. I love being able to give a HD picture slide show directly off the camera.
A cool thing about this camera is the 3D panorama recording. I dont have a 3D tv, but you can view the image in a semi-3D viewing mode on the camera itself by tilting left to right, or you can really notice it when you hook it up to a tv. Took some outdoor shots in this mode with people and cars, and this playback feature animated people walking and cars driving on the street. It brought the scene to life, shy of a video, in a way that a still 3D image could not do.
Low light shots: When you choose one of the low light settings, this thing fires off 4 or 5 shots instantly and combines them automatically to record great low light shots, with or without tripod, there's a different setting for both. No complaints at all.
The LCD screen high pixel count picture quality is great! I don't understand why Sony reduced the pixel count so much in t ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)

The sony wx9 is a great camera for multiple reasons. This camera in my opinion is the best point and shoot camera that sony has put out this season. This camera offers a world of features including sonys great panorama mode and the burst mode which allows you to take close to 10 pictures in about one second. Also what most customers dont realize is that this camera has the Exmor image sensor. Sony uses this sensor in only their high end cameras and high definition camcorders. This sensor works great in low light conditions. The zoom is only 5x but thats the best you will see for a camera of that size. I would def. recommend a high speed memory card for this card because of the burst mode and the HD video. As for a case, no ... camera comes with a case, whether it be $50 or $1500 (unless a special promotional deal comes your way), so you will also need a case. For cameras in or around the $200 this is my personal favorite, a close comparison would be the canon elph100hs and possibly the canon sd 1400, also the sony W series are a great way to go if your looking for something cheaper though they lack many graet qualitites of the wx9. Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Couldn't find a better pocket size camera!!
Item.Review:
I have owned this camera for almost two months now and while I am still exploring and discovering more features as i go, I am truly impressed with the camera so far. Amazing features packed in a tiny package! This is what has been the most impressive:
Size - the camera is small enough to fit into a small clutch purse for a night out. It is very easy to slip into the pocket for day to day picture taking.
Excellent picture quality - The images are crisp and sharp. The fine LCD monitor on the camera displays great images that look just as crisp on the computer/TV. Works very well in low light settings well. There are several scenes mode to pick from to ensure the best picture quality for your setting.
Optical steady shot optimization - ensures non-blurry images/vid even w ... hen you're not as steady while shooting.
Full HD movie mode - amazing resolution on video clips even in low light settings.
I-Sweep Panorama mode - what's not to love? Wide angle 180 degree shot for a panoramic view that can be shot horizontally or vertically. The camera takes 15 images at different angles as the camera sweeps across the scene.
Burst shooting mode.
What I have not liked BUT was not a deal-breaker: > The software provide (Picture Motion Browser) is not Mac compatible:( > No Black & White feature on the camera - with the many picture editing software available, it's an easy fix but it should't have been left out! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Cannot Get Over All the Awesome Features!
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to set-up/use and great price.
Picture quality is absolutely fantastic! Some settings I really like are the burst photo setting where it just snaps a whole bunch all at once within a second, which is nice if you want to capture something in motion or to make sure you don't miss something good!
Another setting I fell in love with is the sweep panorama, which gets a wide landscape view.
Yet another setting takes pictures automatically when it sees a smile.
And finally for those of us who like to take pictures of ourselves with a friend, but there's no one around to take them, there is a two-person face recognition timer that snaps when two faces are in the camera view so when you have the camera extended out in front of you, at least you'll know your fa ... ces will be in the picture.
Price is definitely reasonable (I got it on sale for 159.99), quality is outstanding, and the unique features are what I love best. Have not used the video yet. Battery life seems decent so far, I'll probably have an extra handy just in case. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good features and easy to use
Cons: Short battery life, blurry pictures at times
Excellent camera with all the bells and whistles. The camera is easy to use for most functions and is easy to use as both a still and a movie camera. All of the functions are easy to find and the menu is very intuitive. The pictures were of good quality, but I found them to be slightly blurry at times (probably due to my usage rather than the camera). This may have to do with the fast lens time. The only issue that I would note is that the battery is a little quick to discharge especially when using the movie function.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good price, image quality, lots of options
Cons: Need more explanation of features
I have only had this camera for about a month-and-a-half. I wanted an easy-to-use point and shoot camera for use on vacations, holidays and for family occasions. I also wanted a good price, which I got. The clarity of images is great and there are lots of options and features to choose from. The panoramic shooting is particularly impressive and easy. Unfortunately, the wide array of features/options can be confusing and difficult to figure out and get to. Although the on screen display is helpful, it would be more helpful to have an actual manual with more thorough explanations. As a casual photographer, I lack the technical knowledge to know which features are best in unusual lighting or ... other situations. I haven't used the video feature yet. The screen is a magnet for fingerprints and smudges, so I will be looking into getting a screen protector. Generally, I have had success with this camera and still feel like I got a good camera for what I paid. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Multiple megapixel modes and various video formats MP4 1080/30p and AVCHD 1080i. Lots of manual controls.
Cons: TERRIBLE battery life when using video.
Pro: I was very pleased with the camera's funtions overall. it does so many things. HD video 1080/30P in MP4. As well as 1080/60i (which is just normal 30 fps video) in AVCHD format. Don't let them fool you with the fancy lingo. 60 interlaced frames is the standard DV speed. But I digress. There are many user controlled features on this camera. A nice scrolling wheel and a separate button for recording video and taking pictures. This camera can also take still pictures while recording video. I accidentally found this feature although it's not in the manual. It's got a built in wide angel lens as well.
Con: ... r>The battery life on this camera SUCKS! I had to buy 2 extra batteries. If I use the video for longer than about 25 minutes, the battery will be completely drained no matter which recording mode you're in. If you are just taking pictures, the battery life is just OKAY. But the video will drain it in a heartbeat. And I think the 25 minutes is a generous liberal estimation. Note: If you plan to buy more batteries, go to a popular auction site to purchase them. I bought two 900mAh batteries for $6. Compared that to $50 for one of the Sony brand. The battery provided when you buy the camera is only 600mAh.
Conclusion: If you can get past the low battery life, it is a really neat little camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)

I knew this one wasn't waterproof, but after my fiasco with the XP20, I just wanted to get a good camera and forget about having it waterproof. After bringing it on a hiking trip in upstate NY and to Longwood Gardens in PA, I was blown away by the quality, even during a fountain light show at dusk. While it does not even come close to some of the picture quality I can get with my Canon SLR, it is much easier to handle and peforms excellent for more than most shots. I am also amazed by the amount of features it has as well. While (unfortunately) I do not have a 3D TV (I am still ... in the market for one), the DSC-WX9 is ready with 3D Panorama and 3D pictures. You also have access to white balance, exposure variance, and partly to ISO speeds to make your pictures as wonderful as possible.
The only problem I had was that the battery went after about 5 hours of heavy use. While this is very good in my eyes for a point and shoot, I recommend at least one extra battery that you can charge and keep on snapping. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)

I bought this camera and a Nikon P&S at the same time to compare pictures/value. Overall, I think the Sony is a great value for the money. The color is actually a little more vibrant (some might say oversaturated), but I think it makes for good travel, scenic, and portrait pictures (I'd rather have more vibrant color than washed out colors#. There are several settings -- either point and shoot with no worries about programming the camera, or several specialized settings such as portrait, landscape, twilight, etc.. Two of my favorite settings are the portrait mode which softens the skin tone -- trust me, this is a nice feature #as it smooths out the skin and reduc ... es imperfections such as redness, acne, scars, etc.) Also, I took some night time panoramic pictures without a tripod and the camera takes several pictures at once and overlays them to produce one image with more clarity without the typical handheld blurring problem. The only problem I notice is that the battery life can be a little short at times. But overall, great value for $140! expand » « collapse

The camera also records HD Video and I shot a couple of them, but when I downloaded them on to my computer and played it using VLC Player, ... the video got stuck. Sony needs to fix this issue.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent audio and video!
Cons: Not enough zoom
The WX9 replaces a broken Lumix DMC-ZS3 which I loved. I bought the WX9 for 2 purposes, primarily for video, secondly as a handy still camera to keep with me where ever I go.
This little camera is a beast! You have to get past the size - it is truly quite capable of getting great results not just with video but the audio is amazing as well. It's a very close contender with the Zoom Q3HD.
My primary purpose for video is to capture live music events, as a stationary camera and as walk around - right up near the stage.
I was prepared to be disappointed with the audio - audio has been an afterthought on most of these small cameras, but Sony comes through again with excellent audio.( I had a Sony V3 that h ... ad awesome sound capability - I have MPEG videos with awesome sound - because Sony does sound so well.)
It may seem humorous to have 2 stereo mics on top of the camera, but they do capture excellently, and the automatic gain control works excellently. I have stood in front of mains speakers and not been clobbered - (unlike my more expensive Nikon D90 which has mediocre audio in comparison - the D90's audio is like good AM radio comparatively. Audio/Video on the D90 was an afterthought to begin with.)
Plus with the WX9 you're shooting 60fps. The video files on this camera are AVCHD, which is like the Lumix - you get .MTS files - meaning you will have to convert them to MOV before importing into iMovie. (MTS = MPEG Transport Stream). I would say in my experience the MTS format seems to be higher quality than AVI.
If you'd like to see what the Sony WX9 is capable of with video, I have a youtube account "tomslounge" - check out the Richard Griffin videos.
The only complaints I have is not enough zoom - it's only 5x, loved the long lens on the Lumix. You're getting Carl Zeiss glass in the WX9 so the image quality is excellent.
The zoom the WX9 does have is a bit too quick, and slow to activate. Meaning, if you hit the zoom it seems to take a bit longer than expected ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good price, lots of features, ease of use, optical zoom
Cons: Higher-resolution picture quality
Overall, this camera has everything you need (and more) for everyday picture-taking, and the tripod mount is useful for more "professional" photography.
I like the built-in battery with USB charging (the camera comes with an AC charger, but it can also be charged through a PC). And battery life is just fine (on par for digital cameras in general).
It's very quick and easy to use, especially once you go through the manual a bit to set basic settings relating to light-sensitivity, e.g. The face finder seems to find my cat's face as well. With so many options, it can seem overwhelming, but setting the resolution size would probably be the main one to pay attention ... to (at least for casual users like me).
The picture quality at higher resolutions is not great compared to higher-end cameras, but it's just fine for me since I typically take pictures at the 2MP and VGA (640px x 480px) levels.
I still prefer working with Picasa over the software that comes with the camera, since it allows more picture refinements, but the calendar feature in the included software is pretty good too, especially if you take a lot of photos of different people--it can tag photos by face/person (maybe Picasa does this too).
For the price, features, and ease-of-use, I would recommend to the non-professional photographer. expand » « collapse

Pros: Incredible photos, easy to use, compact, large bright LCD screen

Thank you Sony! I tried the Panasonic Lumix ZS10, which I still have, and just returned the Canon Powershot Elf 100HS after trying this camera. I just happen to read some good reviews for it and thought, well I've always wanted a Sony, there are just so many I had no idea which ones to try... well let me just say that I was able to get gorgeous pictures the first time I used it! It usually takes me quite a while to test a camera, but this was pretty easy though I still have more to learn! I even got some beautiful panoramic shots, but I guess I stopped too short, but they still turned out gorgeous, way better than my other cameras. Pics ... of my pets do not come out blurry, indoor pictures are great and the camera is fast, not slow like some of the other Sony model reviews I've seen. The sharpness and clarity one me over. I would have liked a pink or purple camera, but black will do because of the end result. The 3 inch 921k dots LCD is gorgeous. Even the zoom doesn't seem to blur the photos I've taken so far. I have been searching for over a year now, thinking that in 2011 I should be able to get a higher pixel camera that takes sharp pictures...and I've found my camera! Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Reasonable price, great high quality pictures and video, great new features, zoom in while recording
Cons: Short battery life when filming, bad video record button
So I wanted to wait 3 months before I gave a review despite the emails I received from Best Buy so here ya go!
Absolutely beautiful camera! I love photography and design programs like Adobe photoshop. Although I haven't tapped into the professional side of it yet, I enjoy having the latest cameras with best features as I am definitely the photographer out of my group of friends.
The pictures are beautiful. I love the settings that they give you for practically any kind of picture. They even have a pets setting which is perfect when I I want to take pictures of my little beagle. Every time I take ... pictures, people are always amazed with how clear and sharp the pictures are. It takes beautiful landscape pictures and I LOVE the panorama setting for those long landscape photos. The camera is so nice that you barely will have to use your flash button. In fact, you're not going to want to use it because it looks so much better without it even in low-light areas.
The HD video is gorgeous. It's great that sony allows you to even take pictures while you're recording so now you don't have to do it once you use a video editing program. Just hit the picture button while you're filming and it tucks it away without any interference with the video. Another thing is that finally Sony has pumped out a great camera that allows me to zoom in and out during film time. The only annoying part is the little whirl sound when you zoom in. So if you're recording something that's really quiet, you'll definitely hear the sound during playback. It's not loud but it is noticeable. Another thing about the HD video is trying to activate it on the camera. There's a specially made red record button for video but it stalls a bit before it records. So you'll hit the button, a second or two goes by without a response so you may hit it again thinking that maybe you just didn't hit it correctly when finally it begins to record but then stops since technically you hit the button twice. Moral of the stor ... expand » « collapse

If I had it to do over, I would purchase a Nikon. My Nikon Coolpix is very compatible to this Sony but at a fraction of the cost. The Nikon is compatible with Adobe Photoshop. Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:

Cons: zooming in when viewing the photo
This is the first Sony I've ever purchased. The price is excellent, so I knew it wasn't a big risk. It's a wonderful camera. Picture quality is fantastic and the video quality is fantastic as well. I have terrible buyers remorse, but this one didn't go back. I really like the fact that I didn't have to buy another memory card because this camera uses SD cards. A+ !!! I really enjoy taking photos and video with it. There is one negative with the camera. When viewing photos, it is very slow to zoom in. Not enough to be a deal breaker.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX9 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent low light pictures, Cool panoramic mode, Gorgeous display, Great video quality, Supurb picture quality
Cons: Battery life, but a spare can be purchased for a relatively low price.
The last time I bought a camera was in 2006 (Sony DSC-W30) so I decided it was about time to get a new one. After looking around at a few different cameras, I settled on this one. After taking over 700 pictures with it (within 2 weeks), I can safely say that this camera does everything I could have possibly wanted it to do and more. The biggest highlights for me are the excellent low light performance (I hate using flash because I feel it ruins just about anything buy a portrait), all around great image quality (I would say almost every picture looks good, and those taken in good lig ... hting look spectacular), panoramic mode (you really don't realize how neat this feature is till you try it), and a beautiful display. The 3D feature is also pretty cool to have, but I don't have anything to view those pictures on as of yet (I really wish I could see what they look like). All of my friends are thoroughly impressed by the pictures I take with this, and a few of them own DSLRs (of course the pictures taken on the wx9 aren't as good as a DSLR, but they're amazing for a point and shoot).
The only major downside to this camera is battery life. You almost need to buy a spare battery if you plan on having it last the whole day, and if you take any videos on the highest quality those two may not even get you all the way there (The HD video destroys battery life, although the quality is excellent). Aside from that, the only minor frustrations I've run into are that the high resolution panoramic mode is difficult to use (there's a regular mode and a high resolution mode, and while the former works perfectly, the later is really difficult to take pictures on without noticing where the individual photos were merged; although when you do succeed, it looks beautiful), and that it can't really focus on small objects that are far away when you zoom in (though that seems to be a problem with most point and shoots I've tried.
I would not hesitate to say that this is one of the best point ... expand » « collapse

The Sony is alot faster than the other ones I've tried,,, not sure if its the shutter speed or what its called but all I know is that it works great!! Camera is a little slow to open and close and to switch to viewing mode. Far away scenic scenes with zoom feature loses some clarity and looks a little fuzzy. Very little distortion with zoom however (no fisheye effect)

In addition, I got the camera, battery, extra battery, case, 4gig memory card, and 2 year protection plan for just around $250 so I got everything I needed for a decent price.
